Generation I.Red: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
Generation I.Yellow: It is the male's job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.
Generation I.Stadium: In the autumn, they travel up rivers to spawn. In other seasons, they make and live in their own nests.

Generation II.Gold: During spawning season, Seaking gather from all over, coloring the rivers a brilliant red.
Generation II.Silver: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
Generation II.Crystal: When autumn comes, the males patrol the area around their nests in order to protect their offspring.
Generation II.Stadium 2: During spawning season, Seaking gather from all over, coloring the rivers a brilliant red. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: In the autumn, Seaking males can be seen performing courtship dances in riverbeds to woo females. During this season, this Pok é mon 's body coloration is at its most beautiful.
Generation III.Sapphire: Seaking is very protective of its eggs. The male and female will take turns patrolling around their nest and eggs. The guarding of eggs by these Pok é mon goes on for over a month.
Generation III.Emerald: It punches holes in boulders on stream-beds. This is a clever innovation that prevents its eggs from being attacked or washed away by the current.
Generation III.FireRed: The horn on its head is sharp like a drill. It bores a hole in a boulder to make its nest.
Generation III.LeafGreen: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

Generation IV.Diamond: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.
Generation IV.Pearl: To protect its family, it will fight with its drill-sharp horn. It lives in hollowed rocks in streams.
Generation IV.Platinum: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
Generation IV.HeartGold: During spawning season, Seaking gather from all over, causing rivers to appear a brilliant red.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

Generation V.Black: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
Generation V.White: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
Generation V.Black 2: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
Generation V.White 2: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.

Generation VI.X: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
Generation VI.Y: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: In the autumn, Seaking males can be seen performing courtship dances in riverbeds to woo females. During this season, this Pokémon's body coloration is at its most beautiful.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Seaking is very protective of its eggs. The male and female will take turns patrolling around their nest and eggs. The guarding of eggs by these Pokémon goes on for over a month.

Generation VII.Sun: When the weather grows cold, its whole body flushes a deep red. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that autumn has arrived.
Generation VII.Moon: Trainers who are crazy for Seaking are divided into horn enthusiasts and fin enthusiasts. The two groups do not get along well.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its horn spins like a drill to steadily hollow out rocks—even harder ones. The coloration of the male is more vivid.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: To attract females, males dance on the river's floor. The females gather around the male that dances most gracefully.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It is the male's job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: It is the male's job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.

Generation VIII.Sword: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
Generation VIII.Shield: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. The Pokémon defends its eggs with its life.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: To protect its family, it will fight with its drill-sharp horn. It lives in hollowed rocks in streams.
